meanings: (좋아하여) like, love, be fond of, be attached to
(유행·의견·규칙 등을) follow; (충고 등을) act (up)on, (formal) heed; (규칙 등을) obey, comply (with), abide by, conform to[with]

meanings.meaning: you can't make an omelette without breaking eggs

examples.korean: These risks are incidental to the work of a firefighter. 발음듣기 이러한 위험은 소방관 업무에 따르기 마련이다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: These risks are incidental to the work of a firefighter. 발음

examples.korean: We wish her luck in her new career. 발음듣기 그녀의 새로운 진로에 행운이 따르기를 바랍니다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: We wish her luck in her new career. 발음

examples.korean: They refused to comply with the UN resolution. 발음듣기 그들은 유엔 결의 사항에 따르기를 거부했다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: They refused to comply with the UN resolution. 발음

examples.korean: He wanted to decide for himself instead of blindly following his parents’ advice. 발음듣기 그는 부모님의 조언을 맹목적으로 따르기보다 스스로 결정을 내리고 싶었다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: He wanted to decide for himself instead of blindly following his parents’ advice. 발음

examples.korean: That immigrant group was gadjo refusing to follow local rules. 발음듣기 그 이민자 집단은 현지 법을 따르기를 거부하는 가조였다. 국제영어대학원대학교 신어사전
examples.english: That immigrant group was gadjo refusing to follow local rules. 발음
